metadata.title: CVE-2012-3544 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Apache Tomcat 6.x before 6.0.37 and 7.x before 7.0.30 does not properlyhandle chunk extensions in chunked transfer coding, which allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service by streaming data.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-3544` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libservlet2.4-java - 6.0.39-1
libservlet2.5-java - 6.0.39-1
libtomcat6-java - 6.0.39-1
tomcat6 - 6.0.39-1
tomcat6-admin - 6.0.39-1
tomcat6-common - 6.0.39-1
tomcat6-examples - 6.0.39-1
tomcat6-extras - 6.0.39-1
tomcat6-user - 6.0.39-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tomcat6 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.0.39-1').
